title: President of the European Central Bank - Wikipedia
snippet: The current president of the European Central Bank is Christine Lagarde, previously the chair and managing director of the International Monetary Fund. The president heads the executive board, Governing Council and General Council of the ECB, and represents the bank abroad, for example at the G20.

title: Organisation
snippet: The ECB’s President is Christine Lagarde and the Vice-President is Luis de Guindos.

title: Executive Board
snippet: to manage the day-to-day business of the ECB; to exercise certain powers delegated to it by the Governing Council. These include some of a regulatory nature. Christine Lagarde · President of the ECB · Luis de Guindos · Vice-President of the ...

title: European Central Bank - Wikipedia
snippet: While Duisenberg had been the head of the EMI (taking over from Alexandre Lamfalussy of Belgium) just before the ECB came into existence, the French government wanted Jean-Claude Trichet, former head of the French central bank, to be the ECB's first president.
